Cows are raised as livestock for meat (beef and veal), as dairy animals for milk and other dairy products, and as draft animals (oxen or bullocks) (pulling carts, plows and the like). Other products include leather and dung for manure or fuel. In some regions, such as parts of India, cattle have significant religious meaning.

Cattle are farmed for meat (beef and veal), for milk (see dairy cattle) and for hides, which are used to make leather.
